title: Addition Practice Exam
description: Test your understanding of basic addition

questions.question: What is $2 + 3$?
questions.explanation: When you add 2 and 3 together, you get 5. You can count: 3, 4, 5.

questions.question: In the problem $4 + 5 = 9$, what is the sum?
questions.explanation: The sum is the answer when you add numbers together. In this problem, 9 is the sum.

questions.question: Which property says that $3 + 5 = 5 + 3$?
questions.explanation: The Commutative Property of addition says you can add numbers in any order and get the same answer.

questions.question: What is $7 + 0$?
questions.explanation: Adding zero to any number gives you the same number. This is the Identity Property of addition.

questions.question: Sarah has 3 apples. Her friend gives her 4 more. How many apples does Sarah have now?
questions.explanation: This is an addition problem: 3 + 4 = 7. Sarah has 7 apples in total.

questions.question: In the addition problem $5 + 3 = 8$, what are the addends?
questions.explanation: The addends are the numbers being added together. In this problem, both 5 and 3 are addends.
